title: Field Maintenance Technician
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 14 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Field Maintenance Technician (Contract to hire) to join our New York team. The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests. The role is primarily responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to: guest lockouts, emergency relocations and communication to keep Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

This position will require weekend and evening shifts but will not exceed a total of 40 hours/week.

What you will mostly focus on:

  • Assist Operations Managers in the set-up of the units with un-boxing, furniture assembly and installation of frames, sconces, and large mirrors.
  • Complete maintenance tasks to ensure positive guest experience such as repairs of furniture (broken bed frames, loose legs on tables and chairs)
  • Assist in delivering missing items to clients, such as glassware, lighting, small appliances, etc.
  • Supervise outsourced technicians while working on resolving an emergency in our apartments (locksmith, plumber etc.)

What you may focus on:

  • Perform messenger related duties such as collecting paperwork, delivering items, receiving mail
  • Deliver keys to front desks, or placing lockboxes for client arrivals

What we are looking for:

  • Willingness to get your hands dirty as needed to achieve operational excellence
  • Great at handy work
  • Must be comfortable using tools such as drills, hammers, mounting
  • Can perform heavy lifting when needed
  • Is flexible and available to work weekends and or evenings
  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Hard working with great attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and remain calm under pressure
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • A positive, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Private life and health insurance plan
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!
At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

description:

We are currently looking to recruit a BI Analyst based in Athens to join our high performing BI team (remote working within Europe will be considered for this position). This role is key to supporting decision making and revenue growth by focusing on leading accurate, relevant and timely business insights. You’ll have a strong command of data, statistical and algorithmic techniques as well as a demonstrated practical ability to determine where to invest time. You’ll be able to synthesize actionable findings across diverse assignments, and present to an audience with varying levels of background in analytics. If you got excited by what you’ve read and you enjoy working in a positive and collaborative environment, surrounded by talented and motivated colleagues we would love to hear from you.

What you will focus on

  • Develop new, regular and automated reports from existing databases
  • Provide end to end KPI tracking or ad hoc analysis as required by defining requirements and providing business insights
  • Develop new models and tools, and communicate findings to leadership and wider team to enable informed strategic decisions
  • Manage QA data, data processes, KPIs and various metrics
  • Act as liaison with key business partners, ensuring full understanding of data flow, data integrity and business systems quality
  • Conduct A/B testing

What we are looking for:

  • 2-4 years of data analytics experience - excellent scripting skills in PostgreSQL, Tableau or similar for the purpose of data gathering, QA, analytics and modelling.
  • BSc in relevant subjects (i.e. Math, Applied Computer or Data Science, Economics, Statistics and/or Business) is required, MSc will be considered a plus
  • Analytical mindset and detail-oriented with ability to focus and prioritize demanding workload
  • Self-motivated, self- organised individual, able to work independently
  • Agile team-working experience and excellent team spirit
  • Knowledge of data libraries such as sklearn and pandas, Python, and ML techniques such as Decision Trees, Regression, Clustering, SVM, Bayesian networks is a strong plus.

Your benefits:

  • Workstation of your choice
  • Competitive salary
  • Annual Performance Bonus
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Mobile Data Plan
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

description:

We are looking for a General Manager for our imminent launch in the city of Madrid.

The GM position is one of the most exciting and impactful roles at Blueground. As the leader of Madrid office and a member of Blueground’s global leadership team, you will own your P&L and manage all business activities: from hiring your team, to on-boarding and marketing units, to building strong relationships with the local real estate industry. You will be responsible for launching, scaling and owning the Madrid market. If you like ownership, leadership and hustling, while being very strategic and analytical in your approach, this is the right role for you.

What you will focus on:

  • Owning the P&L for Blueground's Madrid's business
  • Building and scaling a best-in-class team for real estate, operations and sales
  • Defining city priorities and goals, and managing performance on a monthly and quarterly basis by setting relevant KPIs and incentive structure
  • Identifying unexplored opportunities and adapting the business model to local requirements, taking into account potential regulatory constraints
  • Staying actively educated on Madrid's real estate trends to adapt and refine leasing strategy
  • Shaping and sharing best practices with the rest of the network towards the constant efficiency improvement of our global operations.
  • Being the face of Blueground in Madrid - local PR and networking events
  • Collaborating with Product, Revenue Management, Marketing, Technology and Client Experience teams to meet the needs of local market

What we are looking for:

  • Relevant experience (at least 5 years) in leadership roles and ideally managing own P&L and building a high-performing team
  • Entrepreneurial drive, adaptability, and focus on results
  • Ability to work independently, effectively and efficiently
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives
  • Analytical and data-driven decision making
  • A team player that will fit with our values and add to our culture

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Discretionary annual bonus scheme
  • Stock options plan
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai

We are looking for a Demand Planner to join our high performing Design and Supply Chain team, based in Istanbul. This role will be responsible for managing demand-supply risks and communicating effectively with stakeholders. Collaborating with city GM’s, product & design team and all related parties of Supply Chain, you will ensure the required furniture are always at disposal. You will have a great understanding of the demand forecast for our markets, monitor global inventory levels and take action according to the output of this initiative. If you liked what you read and you feel you can make a difference in this role we would love to hear from you!

What you will focus on:

  • Improving demand planning systems, infrastructure, tools and methods
  • Reporting, analyzing and delivering KPIs (Forecast Bias & Accuracy, Supply Chain KPIs, Stock-on-hand days, overstocks)
  • Managing short-term demand requests
  • Identifying potential supply risks and aligning with internal customers
  • Highlighting gaps in the demand planning and ensuring any required actions are on track (both within supply chain and extended Blueground team)
  • Obsolete stock management, identifying risks, taking the required actions to accelerate sales and avoiding excess stock
  • Managing the Supply Chain responsibilities in various projects
  • Acting as a master data specialist, maintaining master data activities
  • Preparing orders for export operations by analyzing forecast and stock availability
  • Defining stock parameterization and improving stock level, while securing high standard service level

What we are looking for:

  • University Degree either from Engineering departments or BA
  • Minimum 2 years Supply Chain Experience (demand/ supply planning or Sales Forecasting)
  • Ability to manage conflicting priorities while working with tight deadlines
  • Strong analytical skills including the ability to distill, synthesize, and draw conclusions on large amounts of data
  • Advanced excel skills
  • Fluency in English is required for this role
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people

The team is building the technology to:

  • Support all steps of our operational process from onboarding and furnishing a new property to publishing it to our website and other channels.
  • Streamline the end-to-end booking experience by incorporating all booking details like payments and customer requests.

  • Define product vision, strategy, and metrics for the platform team.

You will shape both where we are going and how we are getting there, focusing on areas that fall outside the daily responsibility of our business units.

It will be a highly entrepreneurial role with lots of opportunity to define where to focus the team's efforts and learn how to drive operational decision making. We anticipate adding to the team over the coming years and we will look to you to help shape how we structure the team.

The responsibilities will change based on the most pressing needs of the business at any given point in time. There are, however, a set of baseline responsibilities that you will be expected to own regularly such as the following:


What you will focus on:


  • Lead end-to-end execution on major, cross-functional real estate initiatives on asset selection, growth and other key areas
  • Manage, update and own business vitals & KPIs that the US leadership team need to be aware of
  • Work across teams (e.g., real estate, finance, sales, operations) to find and implement strategic initiatives which drive P&L impact for the business
  • Work with the business intelligence and finance teams to create necessary reporting dashboards that drive decision making
  • Provide analysis and recommendations to help evaluate new revenue growth and partnership opportunities
  • Monitor our external environment (e.g., market conditions, competitive pressures, regulatory landscape) and derive implications for the business
  • Serve as the connective tissue across teams to drive alignment on priorities across key business functions through the OKR and strategic planning process
  • Build presentations and reports that help the executive team to make decisions without having to search for the data
What we are looking for:


  • 3-5+ years of experience in a high growth startup, management consulting, investment banking, private equity, or similar fast-paced environment
  • Proven analytical skills with the ability to translate findings and apply to project management
  • Exceptional relationship-builder who works well with people from technical and business backgrounds
  • Excellent communicator with the ability to influence and manage wide-scale projects across multiple levels and functions of the organization
  • Exceptional critical thinking skills, being able to solve problems with practical judgment
  • Incredibly organized with impeccable attention to detail
  • Ability to work under pressure and identify, prioritize and resolve issues quickly and independently
  • Ability to effectively handle shifting priorities and adapt to changing demands in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Be willing to dive into the trenches and do whatever necessary to get the ball across the line

title: Maintenance Specialist
description:

We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Maintenance Specialist to join our fast growing San Francisco Bay Area team. This position will be based out of San Jose. The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in general maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests. The role is primary responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

This position will require some weekend work; Tuesday to Saturday, or Sunday to Thursday.

What you will mostly focus on:

  • Assist our Operations Managers in the set-up of the units with un-boxing, furniture assembly and frames' installation
  • Complete basic maintenance tasks to ensure positive guest experience
  • Perform check-in/outs to our properties according to business standards
  • Be the main point of contact between our guests and the customer experience team
  • Supervise handyman while working on resolving an emergency in our apartments (locksmith, plumber etc.)

What you may focus on:

  • Manage viewings at Blueground properties for prospective clients or partners
  • Perform messenger related duties such as collecting paperwork, delivering items, receiving mail

What we are looking for:

  • Willingness to get their hands dirty as needed to achieve operational excellence
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Great at handy work
  • Can perform heavy lifting when needed
  • Is available to work a weekend day
  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Hard working with great attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and remain calm under pressure
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • A valid driver's license and a clean driving record with no traffic violations; as well as a reliable vehicle
  • A positive, confident, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Market competitive salary
  • Corporate cell phone plan
  • Joining a fast growing start up

You will focus on bringing on-board amazing people that will love our culture and embrace our values. If you are a target-driven professional, who has a passion for attracting great talent and creating an exceptional candidate experience, this is an opportunity to drive your career forward! As a Blueground talent scout, you will manage the recruitment process from end to end and collaborate with our senior leadership team to bring on board amazing people. title: Field Technician - Seattle
description:

We are looking for a Field Technician to join our fast growing Seattle team. title: Software Engineer, Front End
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking for a talented Front End Engineer to join our Engineering team in Athens and our mission to offer a world class experience to our customers on the web, office based or remote.

We are a tech enabled company, currently making substantial investments in our technology platform, from our booking website and mobile app to our key business internal software, to enable our next stage of high growth.The person in this role will work on our web products with some of the latest tech goodies, solid engineering practices and demanding requirements on UX, analytics and performance.


Our Stack

  • ES2015+
  • Node.js | Express | Koa
  • MongoDB | Postgres | Redis
  • RabbitMQ
  • Vue.js | Angular | Vanilla.js
  • Jest | WebDriver.io | Cypress.io
  • RESTful APIs | gRPC
  • Serverless
  • GraphQL on Prisma up next

Our code sits on Github, is integrated through Jenkins pipelines and runs on AWS EKS & Lambda. We do project management on JIRA, our prototypes and mockups on Figma and monitor our systems and performance on Datadog and New Relic.


What you'll focus on

  • Architect, design and build product features on Blueground’s web products
  • Deliver rich, responsive, mobile first experiences on the browser
  • Participate in SCRUM ceremonies
  • Code in Vue.js
  • Write your unit tests
  • Write your e2e tests
  • Sometimes write your HTML & CSS
  • Automate stuff
  • Depend on a CI pipeline
  • Experiment and create rapid prototypes


What to expect

  • Your opinion to matter
  • To work in an agile, cross functional, devops enabled team
  • To work with a product designer, a product manager and an engineer in test
  • To work on functional and non functional testing
  • To build lots of stuff from scratch and rewrite quite as many
  • To work on performance and SEO
  • To move beyond frameworks and take advantage of modern browser tech
  • To enjoy some quality engineering
  • To get your hands on latest goodies - we’re open-minded geeks
  • A rapidly growing company
  • Cool colleagues :)


Interview process

  • Video call dialogue with People Team
  • Introductory video call dialogue with one of our senior engineers
  • Coding assignment (3+ working days)
  • Technical Interview, 2+ hours long
  • Interview with Head of engineering

What to expect at the technical interview?

You will be called to have a long discussion with your future team members. This discussion will cover many things from CS fundamentals to latest web and Javascript tech. So we encourage you to do a quick refresh on topics like data structures, algos and runtime complexity as well as core Javascript and web fundamentals. We will also try to tackle some real-world software design problems together as we do every other day. It may sound scary but it's really not. We want you to succeed.
requirements:
• 2+ years of full-time industry experience working with web technologies
  • Strong web fundamentals and solid understanding of the 2020's web ecosystem
  • Strong Javascript skills (ES2015+)
  • Strong HTML & CSS skills
  • An eye for good UX
  • Core Web APIs like DOM, Storage, Fetch etc should not be strange to you
  • Really comfortable with Git
  • Excellent communication in English
  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related subject
  • Bonus: experience doing fullstack development on Node.js
  • Bonus: knowing your way around *nix shell
  • Bonus: experience in software testing

At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking for a talented Backend Software Engineer to join our Engineering team in Athens and work on our business critical backend services.

We are a tech enabled company, currently making substantial investments in our technology platform, from our booking website and mobile app to our key business internal software, to enable our next stage of high growth.The person in this role will work on our backend services with a well established development methodology, a robust CI pipeline, solid engineering practices and challenging requirements (you won't get bored).


Our Stack

  • Kotlin | Javascript | Typescript
  • Spring Boot
  • Node
  • Postgres | MongoDB | Redis
  • RabbitMq
  • Spock | Jest | Cypress.io
  • Rest | GraphQL
  • Docker | AWS | k8s on EKS
  • Serverless

Our code sits on Github, is integrated through Jenkins pipelines and runs on AWS EKS & Lambda. We do project management on JIRA, our prototypes and mockups on Figma and monitor our systems and performance on Datadog and New Relic.


What you'll do

  • Architect, design and build our internal platform and tools
  • Participate in SCRUM ceremonies
  • Code services and APIs
  • Write your unit tests
  • Write your e2e tests (functional & performance)
  • Automate stuff. Like a lot.
  • Be religious with Git
  • Depend on a CI pipeline
  • Experiment, learn and have fun


What to expect

  • To work in agile, cross functional, DevOps enabled teams
  • To work with a product manager and an engineer in test
  • To work on functional and non functional testing
  • To work on performance
  • To get your head around a quite big problem domain
  • To solve hard problems
  • To enjoy some quality engineering
  • A rapidly growing company
  • Opportunities to do full stack or go polyglot if interested (e.g. Python or Go)
  • Cool colleagues :)


Interview process

  • Video call dialogue with People Team
  • Introductory video call dialogue with one of our senior engineers
  • Coding assignment (3+ working days)
  • Technical Interview, 2+ hours long
  • Interview with Head of engineering

What to expect at the technical interview?

You will be called to have a long discussion with your future team members. This discussion will cover many things from CS fundamentals to latest coding trends. So we encourage you to do a quick refresh on topics like data structures, algos and runtime complexity as well as core concepts of your primary language (e.g. Java or Python). We will also try to tackle some real-world software design problems together as we do every other day. It may sound scary but it's really not. We want you to succeed.
requirements:
• Industry experience in software development
  • Strong CS background
  • Strong skills in one of Kotlin, Java, Python, Ruby, Javascript
  • Strong background in relational databases and SQL
  • Good knowledge of the Spring framework & the JEE platform is a plus
  • Experience in designing REST APIs
  • Testing mindset and an eye for clean code
  • Really comfortable with Git
  • Excellent communication in English
  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related subject
  • Bonus: experience with other JVM languages like Groovy or Kotlin
  • Bonus: knowing your way around the *nix shell
  • Bonus: experience with NoSQL storage (Redis, Elastic, MongoDB)
  • Bonus: experience with binary APIs (Protocol Buffers, Avro etc)

We are looking to recruit an Account Executive - Portal Partnerships to work remotely on the west coast and join our Inbound Sales function. As member of our US Sales team you will manage inbound sales requests concerning bookings of Blueground properties for all US markets.

What you will focus on:

  • Respond and handle sales inquiries full cycle (via Portal Partnerships such as Airbnb/VRBO, phone, email, social tools, etc.) offering clients the best accommodation solution based on their need
  • Maintain an active line of communication with assigned cities local teams (General Manager, Real Estate, Operations)
  • Forecast sales activity and revenue (meeting and exceeding weekly, quarterly, and annual sales quotas and KPIs)
  • Proactively manage your sales pipeline in our CRM (SalesForce)
  • Weekends are required

What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 1-3 years experience in sales or account management in a quota carrying role (experience working in a B2C environment)
  • Ability to run proper exploratory/discovery calls, be an active listener, manage objections and negotiation
  • Customer first mindset and closing mindset with a sense of urgency
  • Comfortable woking in a fast paced environment
  • Use and understand our CRM
  • Coachable individual able to implement feedback
  • Highly consultative, active listener, with strong objection management and negotiation skills

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • 401K plan
  • Health Insurance (medical, dental and vision plans)
  • Corporate cell phone plan
  • Parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

title: General Manager
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 14 cities. We have raised $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking for a General Manager for our imminent launch in the city of Berlin.

The GM position is one of the most exciting and impactful roles at Blueground. As the leader of Berlin office and a member of Blueground’s global leadership team, you will own your P&L and manage all business activities: from hiring your team, to on-boarding and marketing units, to building strong relationships with the local real estate industry. You will be responsible for launching, scaling and owning the Berlin market. If you like ownership, leadership and hustling, while being very strategic and analytical in your approach, this is the right role for you.

What you will focus on:

  • Owning the P&L for Blueground's Berlin's business
  • Building and scaling a best-in-class team for real estate, operations and sales
  • Defining city priorities and goals, and managing performance on a monthly and quarterly basis by setting relevant KPIs and incentive structure
  • Identifying unexplored opportunities and adapting the business model to local requirements, taking into account potential regulatory constraints
  • Staying actively educated on Berlin's real estate trends to adapt and refine leasing strategy
  • Shaping and sharing best practices with the rest of the network towards the constant efficiency improvement of our global operations.
  • Being the face of Blueground in Berlin - local PR and networking events
  • Collaborating with Product, Revenue Management, Marketing, Technology and Client Experience teams to meet the needs of local market

What we are looking for:

  • Relevant experience (at least 5 years) in leadership roles and ideally managing own P&L and building a high-performing team
  • Entrepreneurial drive, adaptability, and focus on results
  • Ability to work independently, effectively and efficiently
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives
  • Analytical and data-driven decision making
  • A team player that will fit with our values and add to our culture

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Discretionary annual bonus scheme
  • Stock options plan
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the center of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

We are looking to recruit a talented Photographer to join our Photography function. As a member of our Photography team, you will be responsible for all our apartment photo shoots and other relative tasks, happening in Boston and Washington D.C . This position is an exciting opportunity for someone who’s highly ambitious and passionate about interior photography while being on the forefront of tech and advertising.

Main responsibilities include:

  • Shoot photos and 3d tour scans on our apartments in Boston and Washington D.C. to meet the Blueground standards.
  • Organize the shootings along with the operations team for the two cities in a time efficient way.
  • Plan and shoot the common areas of the buildings & neighborhoods
  • Get involved in creative projects for marketing campaigns
  • Assist in the pre-photo shooting apartment setup Continuously find ways to improve shooting methods & team processes through workshops etc.

What we are looking for:

  • Excellent photography skills with at least 1-year photography experience
  • Excellent communication skills and a team player
  • Very good in prioritizing tasks and organizing your work
  • Eager to learn new techniques and provide feedback
  • Self - motivated with attention to detail
  • Basic understanding of Microsoft Excel/Gsheets
  • Real estate photography experience will be considered as a plus
